thread.title: Villa Angela-St. Joseph outlasts Roger Bacon, 54-52, to win Division III state championship
thread.title_full: Villa Angela-St. Joseph outlasts Roger Bacon, 54-52, to win Division III state championship

author: Tim Bielik, cleveland.com
title: Villa Angela-St. Joseph outlasts Roger Bacon, 54-52, to win Division III state championship
text:
Complete Box Score » 
COLUMBUS, Ohio — Villa Angela-St. Joseph came up with the clutch plays in the final minutes on the way to winning its third state championship in five years, 54-52, vs. St. Bernard Roger Bacon on Saturday in the Division III state championship game at the Schottenstein Center. 
The Vikings (23-6) went more than four minutes without a field goal. But after Danny McGarry drew an offensive foul with 1:09 to go and his team leading by two, VASJ scored eight straight points in just 32 seconds including a layup by Jerry Higgins off of a full-court pass from McGarry. 
Higgins finished with 16 points. Alonzo Gaffney had a double-double with 12 points and 10 rebounds, and Will Butler added 10. 
The win gave the Vikings their third state title in five years, also winning in 2013 and 2015. They became the first team in Ohio history to play in five consecutive state championship games . 
Justin Johnson had 14 points to lead Roger Bacon (25-5).
